dcterms:creator: R. Tibshirani
dcterms:description: The LASSO problem is a regression analysis method that performs both variable selection and regularization to enhance the prediction accuracy and interpretability of the statistical model it produces.
dcterms:title: LASSO problem

dcterms:creator: J. Liu
J. Chen
J. Ye
dcterms:description: The logistic regression (LR) problem is a statistical method for predicting binary classes. The outcome is usually a binary variable, and the model estimates the probability that a given input point belongs to a certain class.
dcterms:title: logistic regression (LR) problem

dcterms:creator: T. Hastie
R. Tibshirani
J. Friedman
dcterms:description: The support vector machine (SVM) is a supervised learning model that analyzes data for classification and regression analysis. It constructs a hyperplane or set of hyperplanes in a high-dimensional space to separate different classes.
dcterms:title: support vector machine (SVM)

dcterms:creator: P. Richt´arik
M. Tak´aˇc
S. D. Ahipasaoglu
dcterms:description: The sparse principal component analysis (PCA) problem aims to find a small number of principal components that explain the most variance in the data while also enforcing sparsity in the components.
dcterms:title: sparse principal component analysis (PCA) problem

dcterms:creator: R. Tibshirani
M. Saunders
dcterms:description: The fused lasso problem is a regression technique that combines the LASSO and fused lasso penalties to encourage both sparsity and smoothness in the estimated coefficients.
dcterms:title: LASSO problem

dcterms:creator: J. Zhang
S. Nabavi
A. Chakrabortty
Y. Xin
dcterms:description: The power state estimation problem involves estimating the state of a power system based on measurements and models, often using distributed optimization techniques.
dcterms:title: power state estimation problem

dcterms:creator: T.-H. Chang
A. Nedi´c
A. Scaglione
dcterms:description: Demand response problems involve optimizing the consumption of electricity in response to supply conditions, often using distributed optimization methods.
dcterms:title: demand response problems

dcterms:creator: J.-Y. Joo
M. Ilic
dcterms:description: The multi-layered optimization of demand resources involves optimizing the allocation and usage of demand resources across multiple layers or levels of a system.
dcterms:title: multi-layered optimization of demand resources

dcterms:creator: Q. Ling
Y. Xu
W. Yin
Z. Wen
dcterms:description: Decentralized low-rank matrix completion is a problem that involves recovering a low-rank matrix from incomplete observations, using decentralized optimization techniques.
dcterms:title: decentralized low-rank matrix completion
